title: "Riot stop making minigames for us to play when we play champs!"
body:
Riot: ok

*makes minigames for ENEMY to play when we play champs*

I GIVE YOU AURELION SOL! LOL SO GOOD THO TY RIOT!

replies.body: Quick question, what part of Aurelion Sol feels like a minigame to you?
I feel like he or she is referring to the orbiting stars around Sol.And I guess the game is "Dodge the Stars".

That's what I figured might be the case, looking to understand whether minigame's being used so broadly it's now used to refer to AOE damage or skillshots that aren't exactly like existing ones though. Not a particularly useful term if so.

I assume people are slapping the term "Minigame" on champs that require you to play (as,with or against) differently  than other champs.For example when {{champion:27}} is in the game,you can't play as or against him like any other champ.The enemy is playing the "Don't chase Singed" minigame & the Singed player is playing "Running Sim 2016".

Of course,the size of the minigame & how it affects the game varies.{{champion:72}}'s minigame has a lot more impact because of the possible teamfights or skirmishes around the Dominion rocks.{{champion:432}}'s chime quest allows him to roam quicker because of the move speed,so you got to be careful of his roams.{{champion:75}} is just a farming sim & requires the enemy  to either put him behind HARD to delay the inevitable or finish the game before the inevitable happens.Many champs bring their own sort of "minigames" to the game but that's just them being different & requiring players to do something to the way they play.And with the continue use of Roster updates,these "minigames" will continue to appear.So yes,the term is being used very broad because people are doing more than just playing League of Legends.

Which means you guys at Riot is doing something right to make certain matches of League feel different from others.Not all of them & it's not perfect,but you guys are taking the right steps somewhere in differentiating champs.

"{{champion:72}} 's minigame **has a lot more impact** because of the possible teamfights or skirmishes around the Dominion rocks."

HA!

Yeah the current minigames off the top of my head are:

Bard passive: Collect all the chimes (not sure this classifies tho but I think it does)
Fiora ult: Hit all the vitals (and technically passive too)

But these were for the player to play lol

Now for Aurelion its for the ENEMY to play Dodge the stars. In my current pbe games so far, they aren't doing so well :/

Also in case you're confused, the "minigames" (in my mind) are a side activity you have to do while playing the game originally. Hence with bard you have to do all support stuff but at the same time, you have to know when to leave for chimes and when to come back. With fiora, you gotta somehow hit the vitals while trying to kill the enemy. And with Aurelion Sol, the enemy has to somehow dodge your stars while they just cs.

Not saying its a bad thing on Sol, just saying that its there lol.
As clarification then is Karthus Q a minigame to you? Similar dodge the stuff gameplay in a way that's different to other champions (frequency primarily).

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6ys2byHB,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-09T02:43:23.675+0000)
>
> As clarification then is Karthus Q a minigame to you? Similar dodge the stuff gameplay in a way other champions don't.

no I don't see that as a minigame. I can see the confusion though. The thing is that Sol's passive is exactly that, his passive. It's up at all times. Meaning every second that you're near Sol you have to be wary of the possibility that one of those stars could hit you or their range could increase. Karthus Q on the other hand is not up all the time (unless the karthus casts is continually) and the simple counterplay to that is be near minions. If you're near minions it won't be worth it and the karthus will run out of mana if he continues.

More examples are like the other post said:
-Skarner's passive (have to collect the shrines in the jungle as the skarner may beat your jungler up if he gets them all),
- this could just be me but there's also dodge the hook but thats only because only one hook needs to land on the right champ to win the game
-Illaoi's e passive is another. If you're turned into a vessel you have to cs and be wary of the tentacles while you're csing (or just stay under tower and kill them)

It's mostly on the newer champs lol. Don't get me wrong, I actually DO like this minigame on Sol and I love sol himself as he has weaknesses (get close and he can't do anything) and the player has the control with it. 

Another definition for "minigame" is once the player hits an ability, it basically says "do these actions and you win". For instance, when fiora ults its "hit these 4 vitals and you win". For Bard its "get all the chimes and you win (more chimes=more meep damage and more slow right?). For Illaoi its "Kill the vessel and you win". This doesn't apply to karthus as he isn't "Hit your Q and you win". Also note that these are mid-lategame (except fiora shes all game, sry I kinda hate her with her true dmg bs and w lol). Like early game most of these don't apply but lategame if one of these happens, the minigame then applies.

edit: jsyk I'm ok with the minigames. I feel they make champs unique. I was just echoing a few posts I had seen on the boards where players were like "I wish they would stop with the minigames. Makes more work for us". I'm personally ok with them and was semi making a mock post while at the same time thanking you for sol lol (he's awesome). But still, screw fiora and her true dmg bs -_-

I thought about it..but really..I think him and zyra are kinda just zone control, dongers being slower, more deliberate *this is my house*, zyra being more temp hot zone bursty zone control. It's not really a minigame when it's their **whole** game. =P

The tentacle thing really is only a part of Illaoi, other than that she doesn't play too from {{champion:86}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:14}}{{champion:72}}  - in the, 'build tanky, run at people, hope you still have enough health to survive once you get there, and start hammering away at people' kinda way.
She just has the minigame setup of the tentacles that determines if she'll be successful or not in the 'once you get there' part.

Also like {{champion:45}} and {{champion:75}}, while a **huge** part of their power comes from their mini-game stacking, doesn't completely dwarf their playstyle. Yes, Nasus will spend 20mins in his 'minigame', but once that's done he'll more or less join the rest of the league world and play similar to champs in his class, just his effectiveness once he rejoins the world was determined 10-15minutes ago, not in the moment so much.
And {{champion:45}} pretty much just plays as a normal cc burst mage, just with the ticking time bomb power spike overload, start weaker than other burst mages, end strongest possible burst mage in the game, the 'clock' just ticks faster/slower depending on how well his minigame went.

But, yah, {{champion:74}} never really leaves his 'game', it's just who he is. Swaggering his way around his zone from level 1-18.

I personally don't see it as a mini game. It's simply a passive Karthus E that can grow.

I feel it's being used to describe passive abilities that completely change how one has to play as/against a champ, forcing an entire gameplay shift due to something passive, rather than actively reactive. 

Skarner's pillars, Aurelion's orbiting stars, Fiora's passive etc
I think the passive vs active play is key.
referring to Sol's stars as a minigame is pretty damn stupid though
I'm not saying it's anything as bad as the other minigames, I actually think it's fair and fits (requiring your opponent to "run and hide" from the dragon), but it still is a minigame.

No, that'a nonsense. Dodging skillshots is part of the game, not a minigame. Is playing against Diana a minigame because her skillshot is curved? Do you include Katarina's mark mechanic? If you want everything to be a minigame, you can call everything a minigame. It's still fucking stupid though

You don't have to be so toxic.

I'm not saying it's like other minigames, I'm simply justifying why some people think of it as such do to its passive nature rather than being a skillshot ability or even an active one.

For what its worth i dont see A-Sol's passive as a minigame. Its more of an AOE zone control around him. 

On a somewhat related note Fiora's passive is an example of a minigame that the enemy is forced into (protect your vitals or else) and its one that some champions dont have the tools to play as fiora dashes around them and they have little to no mobility.

To be honest, minigames are probably here to stay. They provide levels of challenges that can make plays based off of skill, (like Juggling axes) and involving the opponent, inherently adds counterplay. (Like being able to shot a skill shot where those axes would land.) 

I use Draven as an example because while mini games have become a hot topic as of late, Draven is fairly old, and was probably one of the first champs to have a mini game in there kit. Riot knows that mini games can work.
Idk, I like the Passive and W. It's unique.
I don't really see it as a minigame... mini games require you to decently alter the way you play, this doesn't really. It would be like calling Sunfire Cape a mini game of 'Dodge the Aura'.
